auto_merge.commit_message:
* `PyDict_GetItemRef` was added in Python 3.13 API and Stable ABI
* Fallback implementation `__Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef` for Py < 3.13 should
use `PyDict_GetItemWithError` from the Stable ABI and and return -1/0/1
as appropriate.
* `PyList_GetItemRef` should only be called if borrowed refs aren't faster (and safely usable).
* `PyDict_GetItemRef` is generally preferable if it's available.
auto_merge.commit_title: Fix implementation and usage of PyDict_GetItemRef and PyList_GetItemRef (GH-6647)

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
* `PyDict_GetItemRef` was added in Python 3.13 API and Stable ABI
* Fallback implementation `__Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef` for Py < 3.13 should use `PyDict_GetItemWithError` from the Stable ABI and and return -1/0/1 as appropriate.
* Rework implementation of `__Pyx_ExportVoidPtr`
* Rework implementation of `__Pyx_PyDict_GetItem`
* Rework implementation of `__Pyx__GetModuleGlobalName`

comment_data.body:
This can just be merged I think

```suggestion
#if (CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API  || CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS) && __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d0000
#define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) PyList_GetItemRef(o, i)
#define __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result) PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1074,7 +1074,10 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStrWithError(PyObject *dict,
   #define __Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) Py_SIZE(obj) = (size)
 #endif
 
-#if CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS && PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d00b1
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API && __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d0000
+#define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) PyList_GetItemRef(o, i)
+#define __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result) PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)
+#elif CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS && PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d00b1
 #define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) PyList_GetItemRef(o, i)
 #define __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result) PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)
 #elif !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS

comment_data.body:
Not your error, but this doesn't look equivalent to the others in that it never returns 0.

It probably just needs a test for `AttributeError`

Don't think this change is needed. `__PYX_UPDATE_DICT_CACHE` does nothing without `CYTHON_USE_DICT_VERSIONS` so it's fine to use generally.

This'll also force catch Python 3.12 and higher so it's pretty broad.

This looks to be broken (it isn't currently tested well because it's only tested in `fail_in_init_after_atexit` in `module_init.srctree` and srctree tests aren't currently run with Py_LIMITED_API set in the Limited API tests. So you only find out about it by enabling it more generally).

I think it probably just needs to raise `NameError` in this case.
Yes, you are right, thanks.

comment_data.body: Oh, I messed up. This is using the abstract `PyObject_GetItem`, so yes, I will never return 0. Let me look again into it.
OK, you are right, the `*dict_cached_value` and `*dict_version` arguments are only used via the `__PYX_UPDATE_DICT_CACHE` macro, so the extra guard is not needed. I'll fix.
OK, let me look into it.
This seems the wrong thing to do when building for Limited API < 0x030d0000 on a Python 3.13 system.

Isn't this just covered by the case above? (`__PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX` is just `PY_VERSION_HEX` when limited API is off)

comment_data.body:
This line seems difficult to spot.
```suggestion

#elif !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
```
Similar to the other case that I commented in `ObjectHandling.c`, I'd prefer if the `#elif` and `#else` were reversed here. But given the non-trivial code that they guard, I could also live with keeping the line history as it is. Can't decide which I value higher.

Let's keep this separate to make it more readable. (We discard empty lines on the way out, so this never hurts user visible files.)
```suggestion
#endif

```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1084,11 +1084,10 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStrWithError(PyObject *dict,
 #else
 #define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) PySequence_GetItem(o, i)
 #endif

comment_data.body:
Could you move this case one up as
`#elif CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS || CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS`

I find it easier to list positive cases ("if this flag or that flag is set, then we do this") rather than naming a list of exceptions that then still have their own special case, but presented as `#else`. It's the flags triggering the special case, not their absence.

I'm not sure how much it matters, but I think we still prefer

```
#define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) __Pyx_NewRef(PyList_GET_ITEM(o, i))
```

for Python 3.14 outside the limited API and with `CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS` disabled. It avoids a type-check and a boundscheck and I think it's mostly in places where we're confident of both of these.

Maybe that suggests a slight naming issue since in the current version
* `__Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef` is "as close as we can get to `PyDict_GetItem`
* `__Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef` is "as close as we can (safely) get to `__Pyx_NewRef(PyList_GET_ITEM(o, i))`"
so they aren't quite the same thing

comment_data.body:
I think what David meant was that both list and dict are really independent. While `PyDict_GetItemRef()` is generally preferable if it's available (as in your previous version), `PyList_GetItemRef()` is not preferable and should only be used if we can't go faster.

Could you try separating the two functions to allow this different preference?

comment_data.body:
Do you guys want to enable this check to mimik in full CPython's semantics? For the time being, I think Cython always call `__Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef` with `dict` instances, so the check is not really needed.
Or should I just forget about it and even remove the note and commented-out code?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1074,34 +1074,41 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStrWithError(PyObject *dict,
   #define __Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) Py_SIZE(obj) = (size)
 #endif
 
-#if CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS && PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d00b1
+#if CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS && __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d0000
 #define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) PyList_GetItemRef(o, i)
-#define __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result) PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)
-#elif !CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS
-
-#if CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS
-#define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) __Pyx_NewRef(PyList_GET_ITEM(o, i))
-#else
+#elif CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS || CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS || !CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS
 #define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) PySequence_GetItem(o, i)
+#else
+#define __Pyx_PyList_GetItemRef(o, i) __Pyx_NewRef(PyList_GET_ITEM(o, i))
 #endif
 
+#if __PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d0000
+#define __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result) PyDict_GetItemRef(dict, key, result)
+#elif CYTHON_AVOID_BORROWED_REFS || CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS
 static CYTHON_INLINE int __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef(PyObject *dict, PyObject *key, PyObject **result) {
-  *result = PyDict_GetItem(dict, key);
+  // NOTE: CPython 3.13 performs the following check

commit.message:
Fix implementation and usage of PyDict_GetItemRef

* PyDict_GetItemRef was added in Python 3.13 API and Stable ABI
* Fallback implementation __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef for Py < 3.13
  should use PyDict_GetItemWithError from the Stable ABI
  and and return -1/0/1 as appropriate.
* Rework implementation of __Pyx_ExportVoidPtr
* Rework implementation of __Pyx_PyDict_GetItem
* Rework implementation of __Pyx__GetModuleGlobalName

Fix implementation and usage of PyDict_GetItemRef

* PyDict_GetItemRef was added in Python 3.13 API and Stable ABI
* Fallback implementation __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemRef for Py < 3.13
  should use PyDict_GetItemWithError from the Stable ABI
  and and return -1/0/1 as appropriate.
* Rework implementation of __Pyx_ExportVoidPtr
* Rework implementation of __Pyx_PyDict_GetItem
* Rework implementation of __Pyx__GetModuleGlobalName

commit.message: Refactor to make "PyList_GetItemRef" preferred whenever we need an owned reference directly.
